page.title: 18A TYPICAL LAINDON SCHOOL DAY
page.content: Most of the children in our school walk there. We wait in the playground until the whistle goes. When we get in class we do early work, maths for 30 minutes and handwriting. Then it is assembly followed by playtime. When we come in we continue with the work on our lists. This work could include topic activities, art, p.e, maths, language work. Sometimes we watch a television programme or listen to the radio, as part of our topic work. We have a computer which everyone enjoys because it doesn't really seem like work. Lunch time is from 12 o'clock until 1.15p.m. School ends at 3.10p.m. Many children in our school belong to one of the school clubs. As some children want to belong to more than one, clubs are held before school starts, at lunch times and after school finishes.
